data: ALLERGY Piperacillin-Tazobactam Desensitization (16-Step Protocol)
Patient Care
Vital Signs
Prior to, between doses changes and 60 minutes after piperacillin-tazobactam desensitization. Then BID as per routine care
Skin Assessment
Once, prior to piperacillin-tazobactam desensitization
Communication Order
During and after piperacillin-tazobactam desensitization, observe for signs of allergic reaction and anaphylaxis
Patient Education

Educate patient not to miss any doses or stop piperacillin-tazobactam unless signs or symptoms of allergic reaction occur. If a dose is missed, the desensitization protocol may need to be started again
Communication Order
Minimize interruptions during piperacillin-tazobactam desensitization, piperacillin-tazobactam must be continuously infused to minimize risk of developing a reaction
Medications
Provider to change desensitization start date and time using the 'start' field at the top of the PowerPlan if required
Provider to ensure ongoing dose of piperacillin-tazobactam is ordered after desensitization completed. Ongoing dose is not included in this PowerPlan
